attribute.name: history
attribute.value: 2019-09-16 11:21:13 - classification file created 2019-09-16 11:21:02 - categorize file created 2019-09-16 11:20:30 - radar file created Lidar backscatter derived from raw values in arbitrary units: calibrated by user Ewan O'Connor <ewan.oconnor@fmi.fi> on 25-Jul-2019.

attribute.name: comment
attribute.value: This variable provides the main atmospheric target classifications that can be distinguished by radar and lidar.

attribute.name: definition
attribute.value: Value 0: Clear sky. Value 1: Cloud liquid droplets only. Value 2: Drizzle or rain. Value 3: Drizzle or rain coexisting with cloud liquid droplets. Value 4: Ice particles. Value 5: Ice coexisting with supercooled liquid droplets. Value 6: Melting ice particles. Value 7: Melting ice particles coexisting with cloud liquid droplets. Value 8: Aerosol particles, no cloud or precipitation. Value 9: Insects, no cloud or precipitation. Value 10: Aerosol coexisting with insects, no cloud or precipitation.

attribute.name: comment
attribute.value: This variable reports on the reliability of the radar and lidar data used to perform the classification.

attribute.name: definition
attribute.value: Value 0: Clear sky. Value 1: Good radar and lidar echos. Value 2: Good radar echo only. Value 3: Radar echo, corrected for liquid attenuation. Value 4: Lidar echo only. Value 5: Radar echo, uncorrected for liquid attenuation. Value 6: Radar ground clutter. Value 7: Lidar clear-air molecular scattering.

attribute.name: comment
attribute.value: Height grid from the mean sea level towards zenith.
